availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned Citizens of Henry County would represent that Will T. Sutherland was fined $100. at the Apl Term 1864 ^of Henry Circuit Court^ for striking a man called Isaac Allagood, who signs this petition -- The case was this Sutherland was a soldier in the Army of the United States and had just returned Home to his wife & seven children and Isaac Allagood being his neighbor they were in town together and both took too much whiskey: they fell out & Sutherland struck him: this is the case and the Jury fined him $100 -- Now We say that Sutherland is a very poor man, dailey labourer & the wife & children are entirely dependent on him for support -- He will be placed in jail for this offence -- Therefore we earnestly Solicit your Excellency to remit all the fine -- the costs will be as much as he can pay -- It is truly a case of mercy --

W. J. Brewer, sheriff,
Thos Pearce s. r
Jos S. Drane
J N Coplinger
Jos Thomason
A. Joseph
G T Chilton
W H Wilkinson
N Smith
E. P. Thomas
late clk Henry Circt. & Co Courts
